𒀳 ᴴAPIN 𓉔 𓃀 𓈖 𓍁 heben hebeln
𒀳 ABSIN3 𒆠𒀸𒀸 𒀯𒀳 absinnu "Virgo" #šer'u "The Seed-Furrow"

𒀳 ᴴAPIN < 𒀳 absin₃ 𒀊𒉆 ab-sin₂ #abšinnu "furrow" 𒆠𒀸𒀸 …
𒀳 apın- @ Turk 𒄑𒀳 apıncı "(seed) plow" ⇔ apınmak
𒀳 𒇲 apin-la₂ ≈ abyar آبیار "planter, tiller "

𒀳 ≈ 𓍁 APIN ≈ 𓌹 + 𓌞 pin 𓍄 ? Al•Purᵒⁿ :
𒀳 ᶠereš₄ ≈ vereǧ ≈ "Virgo" 𒀳 𒆠𒀸𒀸 𒋼𒐀 𒄮𒐀 ⇔ Virginis Παρθένος Parthénos
𒀳 ᶠURU: furrow, farmer ֆերմեր fermer ფერმერი permeri
𒀳 ᶠURU > ᶠULU فَلَّاح fallāḥ fellow farmer
𒀳 uru₄ 𒌾𒊒 uru₁₁ 𒄿𒊒 i-ru
𒀳 #erēšu ˢuru₄ #šer'u ᶻuru זָרַע zará' زرع zaraʕ Sart seed "sow"
𒀳 ḥaraθ < Kar karen @ Acker
𒀳 ereš4 𒀳 earth worker
𒀳 erēšu [APIN (ENGAR)] ackern:
𒀳 APIN aPˡin plowⁿ in 𒀳𒇲 planter
𒀳 APIN a •plank ⇔ brachio 𒁕 𒀉
𒀳𒍑 APIN.UŠ •plenus (an official)

𒀳 ᵐengar 𓏠 𓈖 𓃒 𓀸 mungar 𒈬𒌦𒃼 mu-un-gar₃ 𒈬𒌦𒂵𒅈 mu-un-ga-ar 농부 農夫 nonggar 农夫 nóngfūʳ "farmer"
𒀳 ᵐengar manguard man@acker #ikkaru Ackerer farmer

𒄑𒀳 ĝeš.APIN Gespann "plough"
𒄑𒀳 𒌇𒆥 TUK.KIN տափան tapʻan harrow 𒌋 Egge

In Proto-Elamite and Proto-Cuneiform
𓌸 ploughs 𒀳 looked slightly similar to 𓍁, as did arrows 𒋾 (naturally)

𒀊𒉆 ab-sin2 ; absin 𒆠𒀸𒀸 ≈ absin3 𒀳 ; "furrow" #abšinnu; šeru

to sow, plant
to cultivate
to plough
to be tilled (field) ⲓⲉⲫⲟⲩⲱⲓ ⇔ ⲥⲉⲑⲓⲟϩⲓ
to be grown (plant)

𒀳 apin 𒄑𒀳 ĝeš apin "plow" #epinnu
𒀳 𒇲 apin-la2 "planter, tiller" #errēšu aratore
𒀳𒌆𒆥 apin-tug2-saga11 "type of plough"
𒀳 𒍑 APIN.UŠ "an official"

  1. month 𒌚 𒀳 Samnu Marduk - 𒀭𒀫𒌓 Zuqaqīpu (Scorpio) - 𒀯𒄈𒋰 Cheshvan מַרְחֶשְׁוָן/חֶשְׁוָן Tishrīn ath-Thānī Oct/Nov
